name: disliked
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
past simple and past participle of
dislike
B1 to not like someone or something: Why do you dislike her so much? [ + -ing verb ] I dislike walking and I hate camping. Opposite
like
More examplesFewer examplesI have always disliked that feeling of fullness after a large meal.She disliked the president, whom she once described as an 'insufferable bore'.The producer disliked the script and said it must be rewritten.He dislikes any kind of physical contact - he doesn't even like to shake your hand.I can't imagine why she became a teacher because she obviously dislikes children intensely!
